https://djannarbor.losamigosdonjuan.com 16/16

Address: 2135 W Stadium Blvd, Ann Arbor, MI 48103
Description: Mexican joint in a strip mall with a sizable menu of classic dishes, plus daiquiris & margaritas.

summary.snippet: "Friendly staff and service and well maintained dining area."
"Good food ( a bit on the expensive side of options for Mexican food in the area)"
"Ordered chicken chimichangas that has a choice of rice or beans."

most_relevant.description: Everything is inedible. The flavor profile of everything is probably the worst Mexican restaurant in the world, Everytime I goto a Mexican restaurant I can at least eat everything wether it’s good or not. This is so bad I can not eat it. I’m here with 2 others and they can’t eat theirs it’s so bad as well.
Soooo good. Have never been in before but driven by alot. Food was served hot and super good.  Service was attentive and fast. Will be back

The food was ok but nothing that wowed me.
I ordered Enchiladas Supreme which has 4 enchiladas (chicken, beef, cheese, been)
The been was not good at all, the cheese was ok, didn’t like the flavor of the beef but the chicken was really good.
Also got desserts which was the best part, their desserts were really good and I liked the churros so much.

Ordered carry out combo #22 (burrito, taco,, rice and beans). Staff was friendly and service was quick. Food tastes great! packaged very well for carry out. Fresh and delicious! forgot to mention it
comes with chips and salsa as well. adding on to this post with a photo on my recent dining-in experience. Amazing service, amazing food. if I could give more stars, I would! This place is the best

Mixed bag of good and not so good. The traditional margarita was OK but it's got nothing on El Azteco in Lansing.  I had a beef enchilada and it basically had no flavor. However the side of refried beans were very good with a side if chips. The tamales were very tasty but I had a bite of a chicken taco and almost couldn't get it down. The chicken was super dry and chewy.  Someone at our table got the veggie Chimichanga and he gave up on it after 3 or 4 bites.

When our family goes out for dinner it's considered a splurge and something special. Dropping over $100 for below average Mexican food as our food splurge was very disturbing.

I think the issue is their menu is way to big.  7 full pages of options.  They need to scale it back and hone in on perfecting less offering IMOP.

2 ⭐ only for the service

Don Juan was fantastic!
The daily happy hour from 3pm-6pm is such a great idea, and the food was very fresh and absolutely 10/10. The staff was outstanding and the ambiance/decor/music made for an even better dining experience. We will definitely be back!

You’ll find an extensive menu that includes Mexican food for American tastes, as well as a few dishes that are more authentic at Don Juan Mexican Bar & Grill. Bar is well-stocked with tequilas and other spirits. Service is excellent and fast. Prices are just right for the generous portion size.
Took 45 mins to get a Sangria and a taco salad. Beef doesn’t take like ground beef I cook. Disgusting!! Save your money go Los Amiagos in Ypsi.
